items.sentence: Shouldn't you be doing the same thing Tom is doing?
I'm going to try to persuade Tom to do that for us.
Tom grabbed a coffee and muffin on his way to work.
How were you able to solve this problem so quickly?
Confusion and fear could be seen on people's faces.
People's faces were filled with confusion and fear.
This is the book that my teacher recommended to me.
This is the house where I lived when I was a child.
How do you know that Tom won't follow us to Boston?
Tom's hair wasn't so long last year when I saw him.
If you want, you can eat all of these strawberries.
Tom poured the tea into elegant bone china teacups.
How did you know exactly what Tom was going to say?
The police didn't find any weapons in Tom's garage.
From now on, let's only speak French to each other.
All of my children want to go to Australia with me.
Can't you stay in Australia until at least October?
It's only been a week since I arrived in Australia.
Last summer, I moved from Australia to New Zealand.
Which do you like better, Australia or New Zealand?
